401013. Hussites defeated

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • All of the following must occur:
      • The following must not occur:
        • Own Sumava
      • The following must not occur:
        • Own Sudety
      • The following must not occur:
        • Own Breslau
      • The following must not occur:
        • Own Hainaut
      • At least one of the following must occur:
        • The following must not occur:
          • Own Tabor
        • The following must not occur:
          • Own Cechy
    • State religion is catholic
    • Hussites is a vassal of Romanist Bohemia
    • Hussites is a vassal of Hungary
    • Hussites is a vassal of Austria
    • Hussites is a vassal of Meissen
    • Hussites is a vassal of Brandenburg
    • Romanist Bohemia and Hussites are allied
  • Romanist Bohemia exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Romanist Bohemia is a vassal of Hussites

Will happen within 1 days of August 19, 1419
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1499)

Description

With the recent successes of the Romanists and the humiliating peace we have been forced to sign, the Hussite cause is rapidly losing ground, and there is few hope of survival for our faith now. It might be wise to unconditionally surrender now in order to avoid further pointless bloodshed.

Actions

A. Surrender to the Romanists (End Game)

  • Lose 30000 troops in a random province
  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4
  • Cede Morava to Romanist Bohemia
  • Cede Tabor to Romanist Bohemia
  • Cede Cechy to Romanist Bohemia
  • Cede Sudety to Romanist Bohemia
  • Cede Brandenburg to Brandenburg
  • Cede Berlin to Brandenburg
  • Cede Lebus to Brandenburg
  • Cede Neumark to Brandenburg
  • Grant independence to Meissen
  • Cede Sachsen to Saxony
  • Cede Oberpfalz to Palatinate
  • Cede Straubing to Bavaria
  • Grant independence to Austria
  • Cede Oberösterreich to Austria
  • Cede Marchfeld to Austria
  • Event 398011 - Victory against the Hussites for Romanist Bohemia is triggered immediately

B. We will never give in!

  • Change religion to hussite
  • Start a war with Romanist Bohemia

401001. The community of Tabor

Hussites — Not random

Will happen on February 22, 1420

Description

A broken man, Vaclav IV died of a second stroke on August 16th 1419. His brother, Emperor Sigismund, immediately claimed the throne and was acknowledged as rightful heir by the crown lands and by the remaining catholics in Bohemia, mostly in the crown lands Moravia, Silesia and Lusatia where there still was a catholic majority, however the Hussites who at that time already dominated most of Bohemia proper refused to accept him, fearing suppression of their faith and despising him for his betrayal of Jan Hus that led to his execution at the stake in 1415. Armed resistance against royal authority and violence against Romanists, especially Germans, began almost immediately. Queen Sophia, widow of Vaclav, first acted as regent in Bohemia and tried to maintain at least a bit of central authority in Prague and to secure the throne for her brother-in-law, however she was opposed by the Hussites in Prague and had few effective control over Bohemia. On November 13th, she had to conclude a truce with thecitizens of Prague, having failed to suppress them with hired mercenaries, basically acknowledging that the Hussite movement had become impossible to control, let alone suppress it. For almost two decades large parts of Bohemia would be in Hussite hands.

Actions

A. OK

  • +25000 infantry in the capital province
  • +30 artillery in the capital province
  • Land tech investment: +3000
  • +4 base manpower in Tabor
  • +2 base manpower in Cechy
  • +20000 population in Tabor
  • Stability -2
  • -6 diplomats
  • Offensive Doctrine +4
  • Quality +2
  • Serfdom -2

Back to top

401002. Diet at Caslav

Hussites — Not random

Will happen on June 1, 1421

Description

Having beaten back the first crusading army of Sigismund, the Hussites had secured control over a large part of Bohemia. On June 1st 1421, the estates of Bohemia and Moravia held a diet at Caslav where they formally renounced Sigismund's right to the throne and took measures to consolidate Hussite domination of the Kingdom. All inhabitants of Bohemia were asked to either accept the Four Articles of Prague - which stated the basic beliefs of the Hussites - or to leave the country, sheriffs and captains with royal powers were appointed for the towns and a provisional goverment consisting of 20 members representing the different factions was created.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability +2
  • Centralization +1

Back to top

401041. Diet at Cesky Brod

Hussites — Not random

Will happen on September 4, 1421

Description

The Hussites rightly saw the Poles and Lithuanians as their most likely supporters, if not allies. They shared a common unwillingness to be outsiders compared to other parts of Europe. Their dissatisfaction took the form of confrontation over the Germans. While Poland was limited to support from the nobility, Lithuania could offer an ambitious and old ruler. The fact that the majority of the Lithuanian population was Orthodox, and Vytautas himself was rather a Catholic according to the Greek rite, played into the hands of the rulers. The rulers of Poland and Lithuania played cautiously, not inciting Catholics, but not rejecting friendship with the Czechs. In 1421 it became apparent that the Polish king did not want the Bohemian crown, while the Grand Duke of Lithuania was interested. Meeting in Cesky Brod on September 4, 1421, the estates of Bohemia and Moravia proclaimed Vytautas, Grand Duke of Lithuania, as the new king.

Actions

A. Elect Vytautas

  • +100 relations with Lithuania
  • -50 relations with Poland
  • Stability +1

B. Find the best contender

  • -25 relations with Lithuania

Back to top

401004. Settlement initiative

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Utraquists] is set
  • Romanist Bohemia exists
  • Country is controlled by AI

Will happen within 900 days of June 2, 1424
Checked again every 900 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after June 2, 1427)

Description

The war with the catholic supporters of Sigismund in Bohemia, the internal conflict within the Hussite movement and the invasions of crusader armies have catastrophic consequences for Bohemia's economy. Also many of the moderates think that only by a compromise with the Catholics and acknowledging Sigismund as King of Bohemia the existance of the Hussite faith can be secured permanently. Should we propose peace to the Catholics and try to end this devastating war?

Actions

A. We shall not compromise with this traitor!

  • Stability +1

B. Try to negotiate peace

  • Event 398004 - Hussites offer settlement for Romanist Bohemia is triggered immediately
  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4
  • Stability -2
  • Cede Brandenburg to Brandenburg
  • Cede Berlin to Brandenburg
  • Cede Lebus to Brandenburg
  • Cede Neumark to Brandenburg
  • Grant independence to Meissen
  • Cede Sachsen to Saxony
  • Cede Oberpfalz to Palatinate
  • Cede Straubing to Bavaria
  • Grant independence to Austria
  • Cede Oberösterreich to Austria
  • Cede Marchfeld to Austria

401015. Coronation in Prague

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 401012 - Compactates of Jihlava for Hussites has already occurred
    • Event 398005 - Hussites offer settlement for Romanist Bohemia has already occurred
  • Own Cechy
  • Control Cechy
  • Country is not at war
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bohemia exists

Will happen within 10 days of June 2, 1424
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1450)
unless prevented by
Action B of 401012 - Compactates of Jihlava for Hussites

Description

Since the division of our Kingdom and the struggle between the faiths has finally ended, everything is ready for the coronation of the King of all of Bohemia in Prague with the crown of St. Wenceslas now.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Bohemia
  • Size of loans changed to 200 ducats
  • Move capital to Cechy
  • Stability +1

401003. Battle of Malesov

Hussites — Not random

Will happen on June 7, 1424

Description

Almost ever since the Hussite movement existed, there had been conflict between its radical and the moderate wing. In 1423 this conflict turned into open warfare between the Taborites, led by the brillant Jan Ziska, and an alliance of the city of Prague and the Utraquist aristocracy. The brutal internal war cost many lives and weakened the Hussites substantially. A decisive battle at Malesov on June 7th 1424 was won by the Hussites. As a consequence, the influence of the Taborites in Hussite Bohemia increased dramatically, which resulted in a radicalisation of the whole movement, a more hostile attitude towards Zikmund and his catholic supporters and a more offensive strategy. Of course, the battle could have had a different outcome...

Actions

A. The Taborites win the day

  • Set flag [Taborites] for events
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Centralization -1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Serfdom -2
  • -7000 population in Cechy
  • -4000 population in Tabor
  • -4000 population in Sudety
  • -4000 population in Morava
  • Stability -2
  • +20000 infantry in the capital province
  • Leader Prokop Holý becomes active
  • Leader Prokupek becomes active

B. Prague wins the day

  • Set flag [Utraquists] for events
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Innovativeness +1
  • Mercantilism -2
  • Offensive Doctrine -2
  • Land -1
  • Quality -1
  • Serfdom +2
  • -2 base manpower in Tabor
  • -1 base manpower in Cechy
  • -15000 population in Tabor
  • -7000 population in Cechy
  • -4000 population in Sudety
  • -4000 population in Morava
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Stability -2
  • Leader Borek becomes active
  • Leader Ptacek becomes active

401045. Fate of Sigismund Korybut

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 210030 - The Treaty of Melno ratified for Lithuania has already occurred
  • Event 401044 - Sigismund Korybut's Aid for Hussites has already occurred

Will happen within 180 days of January 2, 1425
Checked again every 180 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1425)

Description

When Vytautas accepted the emperor's offer regarding the Teutons, he abruptly changed his position towards us. In 1424 the rulers of Poland and Lithuania defiantly proclaimed an alliance against the Hussites. Sigismund Korybut on his own initiative went again, but Lithuanians denied it. In the future, Sigismund tried to mediate between the Hussites and Catholics, for which at the end of 1427 he was imprisoned for four months. He stayed in Bohemia until the end of the Hussite wars.

Actions

A. He stays here

  • -50 relations with Lithuania

B. We do not need him anymore

  • Leader Zikmund Korybutovic will never be active
  • Lose 6000 troops in a random province
  • +50 relations with Lithuania

401007. Economic consequences of endless warfare

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is at war

Will happen within 900 days of January 2, 1426
Checked again every 900 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1430)

Description

The Hussite wars had a devastating effect on Bohemia's economy. Large areas were depopulated, German merchants were thrown out, trade activity virtually ceased and the peasantry was fighting in Hussite armies. Even after the end of the conflict, Bohemia could not recover completely from this.

Actions

A. How terrible

  • -8000 population in Cechy
  • -4000 population in Tabor
  • -4000 population in Sudety
  • -3000 population in Morava
  • -3000 population in Breslau
  • -3000 population in Sumava
  • -2 base tax value in Cechy
  • -1 base tax value in Tabor
  • -1 base tax value in Sudety
  • -1 base tax value in Morava
  • -1 base tax value in Breslau
  • -1 base tax value in Sumava

401021. Raids to Upper Hungary

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Taborites] is set

Will happen within 30 days of January 2, 1428
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1434)

Description

The influence of Hussite teachings was not restricted to only Bohemia. Hussite preachers, mostly radical Taborites and Orebites, infiltrated all neighbouring territories. While their impact in German lands was mostly minimal, they had notable success in the Kingdom of Hungary, where the enserfed peasantry was receptive to their proto-communist ideas, and even more so among the Slovak peasantry in Upper Hungary. When in 1428 Hussite armies began systematic raids of Upper Hungary, the slowly growing Hussite community in Slovakia provided them with some support which allowed them to effectively control large parts of Upper Hungary until 1434.

Actions

A. Raid Upper Hungary

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Hungary for 60 months
  • +10000 infantry in Tabor

Back to top

401008. Prokop the Great's offensive

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is at war
  • Romanist Bohemia exists

Will happen within 200 days of January 2, 1429
Checked again every 200 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1429)

Description

Since Emperor Sigismund remained unyielding and refused to seriously negotiate a compromise with the Hussites when Prokop the Great tried to approach him in 1429, Prokop convinced an assembly of the Hussite leadership to resort to the force of arms. All factions - Taborites, Orebites, Praguers and Utraquists - had to contribute to 5 new armies that were quickly mustered, numbering about 40000 men and 5000 cavalry, and an invastion of the German territories of Saxony and Lusatia, strongholds of the Hussites' Romanists enemies, was launched.

Actions

A. For the chalice!

  • +40000 infantry in the capital province
  • +5000 cavalry in the capital province
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Saxony for 12 months

Back to top

401022. Liberation of our Slovak brethren

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Karpatok
  • Own Pozsony

Will happen within 5 days of January 2, 1429
Checked again every 5 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1450)

Description

We have managed to establish permanent Hussite control of the territories inhabited by Slovaks which formerly formed Upper Hungary. The part of the Slovak populace that has embraced the Hussite faith willingly supports us, however there is strong resistance from the catholics. If we just manage to keep our hold on Slovakia and let our preachers spread our doctrines, we might be able to convert the majority of Slovakia to the Hussite faith and establish a permanent union between Bohemia and former Upper Hungary.

Actions

A. Welcome our Slovak brothers in faith

  • slovak will become an accepted culture
  • Set flag [Hussite_Slovakia] for events
  • Revolt risk value in Karpatok +6
  • Revolt risk value in Pozsony +6
  • +20 victory points

401023. Loss of Slovakia

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Hussite_Slovakia] is set
  • The following must not occur:
    • Own Karpatok
  • The following must not occur:
    • Own Pozsony
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 129055 - Addition of Slovakia to the Kingdom of Bohemia for Bohemia has already occurred

Will happen within 1 days of January 2, 1430
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1480)

Description

We have lost the Slovak territories again. All hope of forming a united Hussite nation of Czechs and Slovaks is gone, and our Hussite brethren in Slovakia will be exposed to harsh persecution.

Actions

A. Arrrgh

  • Clear flag "[Hussite_Slovakia]"
  • slovak will no longer be an accepted culture
  • -20 victory points

401046. Death of Vytautas

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 401043 - Lithuania accepts for Hussites has already occurred

Will happen on October 27, 1430

Description

Vytautas died in October of 1430. Before his death, he admitted defeat and handed over the Grand Duchy of Lithuania to Jagiello. While Vytautas was being buried, Svitrigaila took over the castles in Lithuania propria. Few days later, the Lithuanian nobles has elected Jagiello's brother Svitrigaila as the new Grand Duke, and the Polish king himself accepted the choice post factum. However, they failed to get the approval of the Polish Sejm. Svitrigaila was a proponent of independent Lithuanian Kingdom, just like Vytautas was, and enjoyed the support of mainly Ruthenian nobles. He tried to persuade Jagiello to agree to be crowned King of Lithuania again, but the Sejm kept an eye on Jagiello, and did not let him meet with Svitrigaila. Western Podolia, Vytautas's lifelong lordship, was to return to Poland. Svitrigaila tried to prevent this from happening, and even put Jagiello under house arrest. The confrontation in Podolia and Volhynia almost brought the 2 countries to the brink of war.

Actions

A. Oh, well...

  • Monarch Hussite Regency becomes active
  • Monarch Vytautas Litevsky ° will never rule
  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months

Back to top

401009. Battle of Lipany

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Taborites] is set
  • Romanist Bohemia exists

Will happen on May 30, 1434

Description

Both parties having realized that it was impossible to achieve a complete victory by military force, Hussites and catholics started negotiations for a compromise at the Council of Basel in 1433. The more radical members of the Hussite delegation, especially its leader Prokop Holý, and the unbending representants of the Roman Church who were reluctant to tolerate what they considered heresy however prevented an agreement. Thus the Hussite delegates returned to Bohemia in 1433, accompanied by a deputation of the Council. While the Taborites resumed the fighting and began to siege Plzen, the deputation of the council approached the leaders of the moderate Hussite nobles, called Utraquists. The Utraquists were hostile towards the radicality and the democratic tendencies of the Taborites and Orebites, hence a national diet sitting in Prague which was dominated by them agreed to the 'compactata', four articles that recognized the main demands of the Hussites in January 1434. This agreement was inacceptable to the Taborites and Orebites, and a civil war for power in Bohemia ensued. An army of the nobles commanded by Divis Borek z Miletinka met the army of Prokop Holý and Prokupek at Lipany near Prague on May 30th 1434. The Utraquists were numerically superior and had a skillful commander in Borek, hence when the Taborite cavalry under Capek ze San fled the battlefield, possibly deliberately betraying their side, the fate of the Taborites and Orebites was sealed. The Utraquist heavy horse annihilated them almost to the last man, and almost all their leaders including the two Prokops were killed. This battle basically eliminated the radical Hussites as a political force in Bohemia and opened up the way for a settlement between the moderates and Sigismund. However had the cavalry not fled, this could have become Prokop's greatest victory and allowed his followers to take control of Bohemia and keep on defying the church and Sigismund...

Actions

A. Utraquists are victorious

  • Clear flag "[Taborites]"
  • Set flag [Utraquists] for events
  • -2 base manpower in Tabor
  • -1 base manpower in Cechy
  • -15000 population in Tabor
  • Aristocracy +2
  • Centralization +1
  • Innovativeness +1
  • Offensive Doctrine -2
  • Quality -1
  • Serfdom +3
  • +100 relations with Romanist Bohemia
  • Stability -1
  • +8000 infantry in the capital province
  • +8000 cavalry in the capital province
  • Leader Borek becomes active
  • Leader Ptacek becomes active
  • Monarch Hussite Regency will never rule
  • Monarch Utraquist regency becomes active

B. Taborites are victorious

  • Aristocracy -1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Quality +1
  • Serfdom -1
  • Move capital to Tabor
  • Land tech investment: +3000
  • Stability -3
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 48 months
  • Cechy revolts
  • Leader Prokop Holý becomes active
  • Leader Prokupek becomes active
  • Monarch Hussite Regency will never rule
  • Monarch Taborite regency * becomes active

Back to top

401011. Compactates of Jihlava

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Utraquists] is set
  • Country is controlled by AI
  • Romanist Bohemia exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Romanist Bohemia is a vassal of Hussites

Will happen on July 6, 1436

Description

After the victory of the Utraquists and the elimination of the influence of radical Hussites who had before prevented a settlement with Zikmund and the Church, negotiations on the exact terms of a compromise, referring to both political and religious questions, continued for two years, and the differences were eventually resolved. On July 5th a Bohemian diet assembled at the Moravian town of Jihlava (or Iglau) accepted the 'compactata', four articles containing concessions to the religious demands of the Hussites that had found the consent of the Council of Basel, subjected themselves to the authority of the council and the Church and acknowledged Zikmund as King of Bohemia. This finally restored peace in Bohemia and relieved the Utraquists from excommunication. Zikmund entered Bohemia and assumed the rule of the Kingdom in Prague on August 23rd 1436.

Actions

A. Accept this settlement

  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4
  • Stability -2
  • Cede Brandenburg to Brandenburg
  • Cede Berlin to Brandenburg
  • Cede Lebus to Brandenburg
  • Cede Neumark to Brandenburg
  • Grant independence to Meissen
  • Cede Sachsen to Saxony
  • Cede Oberpfalz to Palatinate
  • Cede Straubing to Bavaria
  • Grant independence to Austria
  • Cede Oberösterreich to Austria
  • Cede Marchfeld to Austria
  • Cede Karpatok to Hungary
  • Cede Pozsony to Hungary
  • Event 398010 - Hussites accept Sigismund for Romanist Bohemia is triggered immediately

B. Reject the settlement

  • Start a war with Romanist Bohemia
  • Stability -3
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 48 months
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • A random province revolts

Back to top

401014. Jiri z Podiebrad's bid for power

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Utraquists] is set
  • Country is not at war

Will happen within 1 days of January 2, 1440
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1460)

Description

The refusal of the Utraquists to accept a settlement with the Romanists has caused further fighting, of Hussites against Romanists, of Utraquists against the surviving radicals and of the Utraquists amongst themselves. Albeit militarily successful against King Zikmund's and the Church's attempts to subdue them by force, Bohemia is now threatening to fall into anarchy. At this point, the most charismatic figure of the Utraquist faction, Jiri z Podiebrad, decides that Bohemia and his confession can only be saved if he manages to get himself elected King and take up the reins of government. While the idea of establishing a national dynasty on the Bohemian throne is quite popular, it also meets strong resistance: lots of Utraquists would hate to see their power limited by a new King, and thus prefer turning Bohemia into an aristocratic republic with almost non-existant central authority.

Actions

A. Crown Podiebrad

  • Centralization +1
  • Stability +1
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 60 months
  • Monarch Utraquist regency will never rule
  • Monarch Jiri z Podiebrad ° becomes active
  • Monarch Viktorin I * becomes active
  • Monarch Vavrinec I * becomes active
  • Monarch Bartolomej * becomes active
  • Monarch Karel II Vojtech * becomes active
  • Monarch Jindrich II * becomes active
  • Monarch Jindrich III * becomes active
  • Monarch Karel III * becomes active
  • Monarch Jindrich IV Václav * becomes active
  • Monarch Karel IV Bedrich * becomes active
  • Set flag [Utraquist_Podiebrad] for events

B. Establish an aristocratic republic

  • Aristocracy +4
  • Centralization -1
  • Serfdom +1
  • Stability -2
  • Set flag [Utraquist_republic] for events

Back to top

401018. Permanent establishment of the Hussite Kingdom

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Romanist Bohemia exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bohemia exists
  • Own Cechy
  • Control Cechy
  • Country is not at war
  • Flag [Utraquist_Podiebrad] is set

Will happen within 1 days of November 24, 1457
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1480)

Description

Ladislaus Postumus, the Habsburg pretender to the Bohemian throne who was considered the legitimate successor by the Romanists, is dead. Although his relative, Emperor Friedrich III, upholds the Habsburg claim on our throne on dubious grounds, this means that, without a truly legitimate catholic King, the legitimacy of King Jiri and the Podiebrad dynasty is hardly questionable anymore.

It is strongly recommended to save and reload as soon as possible after this event.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Bohemia
  • Stability +2
  • Move capital to Cechy
  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4
  • -2 badboy
  • Event 129053 - Podiebrad dynasty for Bohemia is triggered immediately

Back to top

401016. Permanent establishment of the Hussite republic

Hussites — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Romanist Bohemia exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bohemia exists
  • Own Cechy
  • Control Cechy
  • Country is not at war
  • Flag [Taborites] is set

Will happen within 1 days of November 24, 1457
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1480)

Description

Ladislaus Postumus, the Habsburg pretender to the Bohemian throne who was considered the legitimate successor by the Romanists, is dead. Although his relative, Emperor Friedrich III, upholds the Habsburg claim on our throne on dubious grounds, this means that, without a truly legitimate catholic King, the legitimacy of the Taborite-dominated Hussite government which effectively rules the country since the Diet of Caslav in 1421, is hardly questionable anymore.

It is strongly recommended to save and reload as soon as possible after this event.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Bohemia
  • Stability +2
  • Move capital to Cechy
  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4
  • -1 badboy
  • Event 129051 - Taborite republic for Bohemia is triggered immediately

Back to top

401042. Lithuania refuses

Hussites — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 210073 - The Bohemian Throne for Lithuania

Description

Vytautas played a long game, wanting to conclude a treaty with the Teutonic Order under the auspices of Emperor Sigismund. When the Grand Duke received the offer of the Bohemian crown, he was cautious about it. Later he refused it in exchange for peace with the Crusaders.

Actions

A. At least, they won't abandon us

  • -50 relations with Lithuania
  • Stability -1

Back to top

401006. Romanists accept

Hussites — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 398005 - Hussites offer settlement for Romanist Bohemia

Description

Zikmund and the Romanist leaders have accepted our proposal of a settlement to end the Hussite Wars. We will accept Zikmund as King of Bohemia in exchange for him and the Church acknowledging the most basic demands of our faith. This will end the fighting and allow the Hussite faith to coexist with catholicism in a reunited Bohemia.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Inherit the realms of Romanist Bohemia
  • Change religion to catholic
  • german will become an accepted culture
  • Set flag [settlement] for events
  • Clear flag "[Utraquists]"
  • Aristocracy +2
  • Centralization +1
  • Innovativeness +2
  • Offensive Doctrine -1
  • Serfdom +1
  • +200 relations with Hungary
  • +100 relations with Papal States
  • +100 relations with Austria
  • +100 relations with Teutonic Order
  • +100 relations with Brandenburg
  • +100 relations with Meissen
  • +100 relations with Luxemburg
  • +100 relations with Bavaria
  • Revolt risk value in Morava -4
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor -4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy -4
  • Revolt risk value in Sudety -4

401044. Sigismund Korybut's Aid

Hussites — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 210074 - Sigismund Korybut's Czech Embassy for Lithuania

Description

Sigismund Korybut, Vytautas' envoy, arrived from Lithuania together with the army gathered in Red Ruthenia.

Actions

A. Fine

  • Leader Zikmund Korybutovic becomes active
  • +6000 infantry in the capital province

Back to top

401000. The Hussite Wars

Hussites — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 129001 - Death of Vaclav IV for Bohemia

Description

The Czech priest and professor Jan Hus developed radical reformatory demands on the base of the teachings of John Wyclif. Despite a guarantee of safe-conduct by Emperor Sigismund, he was executed at the stake for heresy at the Council of Constance in 1415. This could however not stop the Hussite movement in Bohemia. Hus' followers were rapidly growing, and when King Vaclav IV of Bohemia died and his brother Sigismund, already Emperor and King of Hungary was to succeed him, they, unwilling to forgive him the betrayal of Hus and afraid that he would suppress them, refused to acknowledge him and gained control of most of Bohemia proper - while the lands of the Bohemian crown and the catholic part of Bohemia accepted Sigismund. Due to its radical anti-clerical and anti-feudal tendencies Hussitism posed a big threat to the church and nobility in the countries adjacent to Bohemia. Several German and European princes therefore decided to oppose the Hussites and to support Sigismund in his struggle with them that lasted for almost two decades. Should we decide to fight these heretics, we should be aware that this would be internationally regarded as an intervention in favour of Sigismund as rightful King of Bohemia rather than a war of conquest, and that therefore, if Sigismund prevails and manages to restore royal authority, we would be expected to turn over any conquests in Bohemia to the Kingdom of Bohemia.

Actions

A. OK

  • Break vassalization with Romanist Bohemia
  • -400 relations with Romanist Bohemia
  • -200 relations with Hungary
  • -100 relations with Austria
  • -100 relations with Teutonic Order
  • -100 relations with Livonian Order
  • -100 relations with Papal States
  • -100 relations with Brandenburg
  • -100 relations with Meissen
  • -100 relations with Luxemburg
  • -100 relations with Bavaria
  • -200 relations with Dauphiné
  • +100
  • +30000 infantry in the capital province
  • +5000 cavalry in the capital province
  • Revolt risk value in Tabor +4
  • Revolt risk value in Cechy +4
  • Stability -3
  • -6 diplomats
  • Event 179600 - The Hussite Wars for Austria is triggered immediately
  • Event 125600 - The Hussite Wars for Bavaria is triggered immediately
  • Event 132600 - The Hussite Wars for Brandenburg is triggered immediately
  • Event 213600 - The Hussite Wars for Luxemburg is triggered immediately
  • Event 319600 - The Hussite Wars for Meissen is triggered immediately
  • Event 255600 - The Hussite Wars for Palatinate is triggered immediately
  • Event 258600 - The Hussite Wars for Poland is triggered immediately
  • Event 273600 - The Hussite Wars for Saxony is triggered immediately
  • Event 209600 - The Hussite Wars for Teutonic Order is triggered immediately
  • Event 188600 - The Hussite Wars for Hungary is triggered immediately
